Hey, so when I deploy code using robotpy deploy I get this error in my log sometimes and it completely blocks deploying.

[phoenix] CANbus Network Up: sim
Instantiating navX-Sensor on SPI Port 4.
navX-Sensor C++ library for FRC
navX-Sensor SimDevice created.
16:11:18:044 INFO    : deploy              : Robot project requirements:
16:11:18:045 INFO    : deploy              : - robotpy[all]==2024.3.2.2
16:11:18:045 INFO    : deploy              : - pynetworktables
navX-Sensor Connected.
navX-Sensor Board Type 33 (unknown)
navX-Sensor firmware version 3.1
navX-Sensor startup initialization and startup calibration complete.
navX-Sensor onboard startup calibration complete.
navX-Sensor Yaw angle auto-reset to 0.0 due to startup calibration.
16:11:18:161 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : Settings loaded from C:\Users\davey\Documents\Torque\PyQuavo-2024\.wpilib\wpilib_preferences.json
16:11:18:162 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : Finding robot for team 1477
16:11:18:167 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : -> Robot is at 10.14.77.2
16:11:18:167 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : Connecting to robot via SSH at 10.14.77.2
16:11:18:347 INFO    : paramiko.transport  : Connected (version 2.0, client OpenSSH_8.3)
16:11:18:501 INFO    : paramiko.transport  : Auth banner: b'NI Linux Real-Time (run mode)\n\nLog in with your NI-Auth credentials.\n\n'
16:11:18:501 INFO    : paramiko.transport  : Authentication (password) successful!
16:11:18:501 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : RobotPy Installer 2024.2.2
16:11:18:502 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : -> caching files at C:\Users\davey\wpilib\2024\robotpy
16:11:18:609 INFO    : robotpy.installer   : Clearing FRC C++/Java user programs if present
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 198, in _run_module_as_main
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 88, in _run_code
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Scripts\robotpy.exe\__main__.py", line 7, in <module>
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\robotpy\main.py", line 314, in main
    retval = subcommand.run(**kwargs)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\robotpy_installer\utils.py", line 188, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\robotpy_installer\cli_deploy.py", line 249, in run
    self._ensure_requirements(
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\robotpy_installer\cli_deploy.py", line 390, in _ensure_requirements
    pkgdata = self._get_robot_packages(ssh)
              ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\robotpy_installer\cli_deploy.py", line 348, in _get_robot_packages 
    rio_packages = roborio_utils.get_rio_py_packages(ssh)
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\site-packages\robotpy_installer\roborio_utils.py", line 87, in get_rio_py_packages
    return json.loads(result.stdout)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\json\__init__.py", line 346, in loads
    return _default_decoder.decode(s)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\json\decoder.py", line 337, in decode
    obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "C:\Users\davey\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python312\Lib\json\decoder.py", line 355, in raw_decode
    raise JSONDecodeError("Expecting value", s, err.value) from None
json.decoder.JSONDecodeError: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)
[phoenix-diagnostics] Server shutdown cleanly. (dur:0)

[phoenix] Library shutdown cleanly

It doesn’t happen for a random amount of deploys, but it seems like after about 15 minutes of testing and deploying, it comes back. Sometimes I can deploy again and it works fine, but other times it just keeps giving me the error.

Rebooting the RIO and deploying again works as a temporary solution, as does obviously powercycling the robot. It’s not a code error as the code runs fine. It’s also not my laptop as it happens on other programmer’s laptops.

Any ideas?

Probably we should see what stderr from that process is… my guess is something on the robot is eating memory.

I’ve looked into this a bit further, and I have a few pieces of info:

  • When ssh’ed into the rio, I restarted the program by running python3 robot.py run I do actually get a memory error. I can send the exact one here in a few days, no robot rn.

  • There is no sign of a memory error while the robot is running code, so I don’t think its the code itself(?)

  • There is only low memory upon deploying, where the “Available Memory” tab on the Driver Stations goes from anywhere 80MB+ all the way down to below 11MB, again, only when deploying

It happens with the same codebase on other RIOs, as well as a different, smaller (but different) codebase on other RIOs as well. So I don’t think its a RIO issue, or a codebase issue.

Some of my teammate’s guesses are with it deploying packages every time, but I’m not sure.
